author: smiley905
title: not a big fan but pretty nice
review:
this was a gift, but its still an ok set. i like the idea of the slammer being the box way to cut down on the paper lego! (but realy theres so much extra packing these days its a CrAzY waist of paper)
its kinda cool how he falls out when he hits omthing...but only kinda

author: Gus_263
title: Spiky
review: Another well made set, small and don't very useful, but still good for a cheap set. The useful things for any sets are the two pieces on back and in the front of the set, later used in racers theme. For this theme, the car, minifigure and the device to throw these makes a good competition if with all sets from this subtheme. The colors are cool too, makes a good color scheme and turn some pieces useful altough it have symbols. Stickers are also included, but they are optional for the garage of the car, but don't in the pieces, printed ones.

author: andy87
title: Hardly a lego but still fun
review: i got this set when i was much younger and it was one the only legos i built at the time. It isn't a genuine lego because it has different pieces, but it is very fun as a child to play with and makes a fun little toy.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Racers (Xalax) - Spiky Review
review:
This is one of the very first LEGO Racers sets which LEGO did and I think it's a good little set to have. As in every LEGO Racers (Xalax) set this set almost doesn't have any play features. The only play features we get is the same as in the other LEGO Racers (Xalax) sets: The ramp is going to launch the car and the gray bumper can push the driver out of the cockpit. This is a very simple build and we only get a few stickers for the ramp. This is a good little model to have - even for pieces which you can use for MOC's (My own creations) and/or brickfilms.

All in all this set is an good set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de
